Author: jl777c#5810
Content: these "fork" issues from what I have heard is that your own node loses sync with the mainchain, but no other node is affected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe this is disincentive for the spamming?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think I know why getblocktemplate is not putting in all the tx from mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with many dicebets using mempool utxo, depending on the order you add tx to a block, it might not allow all the mempool tx to be mined. the issue is in miner.cpp where it creates a block. I think fixing that would make things a lot better as it would recycle bets that much better, but still eventually utxo will run out

Author: siu - Chainmakers#3920
Content: It could be that 2 bets select the same utxo in the house and when the first one confirms, the second one gets orphaned

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it could be it ends up in your mempool, but not in the real mempool that gets mined

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so your node thinks you did a bet, but really it didnt happen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, this feels like what is happening from the reported behavior
